function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of benefits from poorly maintained large parks","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to nature and outdoor spaces","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate exploitation of disaster management infrastructures and smart city frameworks to counter the pandemic","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliability and scalability issues in pandemic data modeling","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential risk of inadequate surveillance and monitoring of infectious diseases in indoor environments","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shedding of sars-cov-2 virus in wastewater","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in wastewater and potential exposure to the virus during wastewater handling","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of detection of sars-cov-2 in wastewater in australia","category":"Water","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate ppe for wastewater sampling personnel","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contaminated samples during transport and storage","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate rna extraction protocols","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Handling of wastewater samples may lead to exposure to potentially infectious material, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate decontamination of equipment and work surfaces may lead to the persistence of infectious material, posing a risk of disease transmission.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper handling and disposal of used pipettes and other laboratory equipment may lead to contamination and potential spread of infectious material.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of rt-qpcr inhibition in wastewater samples","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential rt-qpcr contamination during rna extraction and setup","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Handling of biological samples and reagents in the laboratory increases the risk of exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate handling of high-throughput sequencing equipment and reagents can pose a risk of contamination and spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of cross-contamination and infection spread during primer sequence removal, read trimming, and data analysis processes.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent rt-qpcr assay results and detection methods","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rt-qpcr positive samples below quantification level","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in wastewater samples","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Detection of sars-cov-2 rna in untreated wastewater samples","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited information on the effectiveness of virus recovery from wastewater matrices","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High adsorption efficiency of enveloped viruses to electronegative membranes","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Handling sars-cov-2 in wastewater samples increases the risk of exposure to the virus.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective methods for the recovery of sars-cov-2 from wastewater increases the risk of inaccurate data and underestimation of virus presence.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate quantitative estimation of sars-cov-2 in wastewater samples may lead to misinterpretation of the virus prevalence in the community.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of rt-qpcr assays for wastewater monitoring","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases through physical exercise","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced outdoor activity time and compressed outdoor activity space","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of electronic products for human-computer interaction in exergames","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Restriction of indoor and activities","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of physical activity and group physical activity due to social distancing measures.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in living environments impact physical activity levels, potentially leading to disparities in health outcomes.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of physical activity due to pandemic restrictions leading to physical and mental health issues","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to internet prevents adoption of online supervised exercise in low- and middle-income countries.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to supervised exercise and mentoring may hinder motivation for physical activity, particularly in times of stress.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced income and limited financial resources due to covid-19 impact.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced access to antenatal
